context_evidences: - Ryan Harrison, the association’s spokesperson, confirmed the new recommendations were developed by its sports medicine advisory committee and approved in late January . It will now be considered by the association board of directors at its next meeting in Gainesville from Feb. 26-27. Reference: https://apnews.com/article/fact-check-desantis-florida-sports-female-athletes-160560972802 published on 2023-02-04 00:04:46

- Robert Sefcik, a member of the sports medicine advisory committee, said making the menstrual cycle questions mandatory rather than optional is consistent with national guidelines for sports physicals developed by the American Academy of Family Physicians, the American Academy of Pediatrics, the American College of Sports Medicine and other groups. Reference: https://apnews.com/article/fact-check-desantis-florida-sports-female-athletes-160560972802 published on 2023-02-04 00:04:46
correction_response: This tweet is potentially misleading. The proposed mandate in Florida regarding menstrual cycle details for female athletes is not a decision made by the governor's office, but by the Florida High School Athletic Association, a private nonprofit organization. The recommendation is also consistent with national guidelines for sports physicals. No final decision has been made yet. For more accurate information, please refer to this article: https://apnews.com/article/fact-check-desantis-florida-sports-female-athletes-160560972802.
note_1_text: This screenshot is of an AP article which is fact-checking the claim outlined in the shown headline. The AP assessed the claim as false.     https://apnews.com/article/fact-check-desantis-florida-sports-female-athletes-160560972802
note_2_text: The tweet calls the move to monitor the health of female athletes "authoritarian." In fact, a citizen committee of experts who want to protect the health of women in sports is the opposite of authoritarian. See the AP fact check.    https://apnews.com/article/fact-check-desantis-florida-sports-female-athletes-160560972802

refute_evidences: - But the proposed mandate hasn’t had final approval, and wasn’t developed by DeSantis’ office. Reference: https://apnews.com/article/fact-check-desantis-florida-sports-female-athletes-160560972802 published on 2023-02-04 00:04:46

- AP’S ASSESSMENT: False. The Florida High School Athletic Association is weighing the recommendation from an advisory committee, but no final decision has been made. DeSantis’ education commissioner is a member of the association’s board of directors and the commissioner also appoints three others, but the association is a private nonprofit organization, not a state agency under the purview of the governor’s office. Reference: https://apnews.com/article/fact-check-desantis-florida-sports-female-athletes-160560972802 published on 2023-02-04 00:04:46
